sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均有"禁止"之意。
means: forbid ： 通俗用语，指直接地、面对面吩咐不许他人采取某种行动。
prohibit ： 正式用词，多指通过法律手段或制订规则加以禁止。
ban ： 语气最强，指权威机关明文取消或禁止严重危害公众利益的事或行为，隐含道义上的谴责意味。

sentence.Network_en: In most of the residence halls we visited, rules prohibit disorderly conduct.
sentence.Network_cn: 在我们走访的学生宿舍里，大多明令禁止胡作非为。

sentence.Network_en: Local zoning laws prohibit building near property lines.
sentence.Network_cn: 本地的规划法禁止在地产边界附近进行建筑施工。

sentence.Network_en: Prohibit the sale of alcoholic beverages.
sentence.Network_cn: 禁止出售含酒精的饮料.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Latin prohibit- 'kept in check', from the verb prohibere, from pro- 'in front' + habere 'to hold'

entry.def: If a law or someone in authority prohibits something, they forbid it or make it illegal.

example.ex: ...a law that prohibits tobacco advertising in newspapers and magazines...
example.tran: 禁止在报刊杂志上刊登香烟广告的法律

sentences.sentence: "I forbid you to call me late at night"
"Mother vetoed the trip to the chocolate store"

auth_sentence.content: They neither encourage nor prohibit anyone from trying it.
auth_sentence.res_content: They neither encourage nor prohibit anyone from trying it.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: They neither encourage nor prohibit anyone from trying it.

auth_sentence.content: United Nations sanctions prohibit Tehran from shipping weapons abroad.
auth_sentence.res_content: United Nations sanctions prohibit Tehran from shipping weapons abroad.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: United Nations sanctions prohibit Tehran from shipping weapons abroad.

auth_sentence.content: United Nations sanctions prohibit Iran from shipping weapons abroad.
auth_sentence.res_content: United Nations sanctions prohibit Iran from shipping weapons abroad.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: United Nations sanctions prohibit Iran from shipping weapons abroad.

stems_affixes.word_buile: prohibit[v.禁止,不准;阻止]+ive……的→adj.抑制的,价格昂贵的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 放荡不羁的, 不受抑制的
stems_affixes.word_buile: un不+inhibit[v.抑制,约束]+ed……的→adj.放荡不羁的, 不受抑制的
exhibit[v.展出,陈列 n.展览品,陈列品]+ion表名词→n.展览会;陈列,展览
exhibition[n.展览会;陈列,展览]+ist人→n.喜欢出风头的人

stems_affixes.value_cn: 抑制;阻止,禁止;[心]感情阻力
stems_affixes.word_buile: inhibit[v.抑制,约束]+ion表名词→n.抑制;阻止,禁止;[心]感情阻力
prohibit[v.禁止,不准;阻止]+ion表名词→n.禁止;禁令,禁律
pro前面+hibit拿住→在前面拿住→不让前进→禁止

Sentence.sentence: Display and sales restrictions: California has a rule prohibiting alcohol displays near the cash registers in gas stations, and in most places you can't buy alcohol at drive-through facilities.
The other measures include restricting portion sizes, taxing and prohibiting special price deals for junk foods, and placing warning labels on the products

sentences.en: Prohibit the sale of alcoholic beverages.
sentences.cn: 禁止出售含酒精的饮料。

sentences.en: The high cost prohibits the widespread use of the drug.
sentences.cn: 该药昂贵, 影响广泛应用。

sentences.en: Rainy weather and fog prohibited flying.
sentences.cn: 多雨的天气和雾妨碍了飞行。

jushi.english: Your bid is so low that it prohibits business.
jushi.chinese: 你们的报价太低无法成交。

jushi.english: Prohibit the sale of alcoholic beverages.
jushi.chinese: 禁止出售含酒精的饮料。

jushi.english: We prohibit air guns and the weapons that might wound someone.
jushi.chinese: 我们禁止使用气枪等伤人的武器。
